articles.headline: Mormon Church to Allow Children of L.G.B.T. Parents to Be Baptized
articles.snippet: The church reversed policies barring children of same-sex couples from important religious practices and said it would no longer label those in same-sex marriages as apostates.
articles.abstract: The church reversed policies barring children of same-sex couples from important religious practices and said it would no longer label those in same-sex marriages as apostates.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints said on Thursday that it would allow children of same-sex couples to be baptized, a remarkable reversal of church policy from one of the religious groups that had long sought to be a bulwark against gay rights.

articles.headline: Anti-Semitism Is Back, From the Left, Right and Islamist Extremes. Why?
articles.snippet: Anti-Semitism is now being harnessed for political ends by ideologies that otherwise would have little overlap. That fusion is new, and dangerous, experts say.
articles.abstract: Anti-Semitism is now being harnessed for political ends by ideologies that otherwise would have little overlap. That fusion is new, and dangerous, experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Swastikas daubed on a Jewish cemetery in France. An anti-Semitic political campaign by Hungary’s far-right government. Labour lawmakers in Britain quitting their party and citing ingrained anti-Semitism. A Belgian carnival float caricaturing Orthodox Jews sitting on bags of money.

articles.headline: Trump Says He Wants Herman Cain, Former Pizza Executive, for Fed Board
articles.snippet: The potential nomination signals the second time in weeks that the president has considered someone with partisan views for the Fed.
articles.abstract: The potential nomination signals the second time in weeks that the president has considered someone with partisan views for the Fed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Thursday that he planned to nominate Herman Cain, who abandoned his 2012 presidential bid in the face of escalating accusations of sexual misconduct, for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport, Neil Irwin and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Finding Biden in Familiar Fix, President Trump Adds a Jab
articles.snippet: President Trump’s response seemed like a typical partisan jab, except for the fact that it was issued by a man who has been accused by more than a dozen women of sexual misconduct and assault.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s response seemed like a typical partisan jab, except for the fact that it was issued by a man who has been accused by more than a dozen women of sexual misconduct and assault.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, ignoring his own troubled history with women and bragging about sexual misconduct, went after Joseph R. Biden Jr. via Twitter on Thursday, posting a video that mocked the former vice president for his handsy approach to politicking.
articles.byline: By Annie Karni and Sydney Ember

articles.headline: Ethiopian Crash Report Indicates Pilots Followed Boeing’s Emergency Procedures
articles.snippet: While the findings are not final, initial evidence has raised new concerns about whether Boeing and federal regulators provided sufficient guidance for pilots of the new 737 Max model.
articles.abstract: While the findings are not final, initial evidence has raised new concerns about whether Boeing and federal regulators provided sufficient guidance for pilots of the new 737 Max model.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boeing dismissed concerns about a powerful new anti-stall system on the 737 Max for months, insisting that pilots could deal with any problems by following a checklist of emergency procedures.
articles.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff, David Gelles, James Glanz and Hannah Beech

articles.headline: U.S. Adds 196,000 Jobs in March, a Return to Solid Growth
articles.snippet: After a lackluster performance in February, the job market bounced back in March. February’s number of new jobs was also revised upward, to 33,000 from 20,000.
articles.abstract: After a lackluster performance in February, the job market bounced back in March. February’s number of new jobs was also revised upward, to 33,000 from 20,000.
articles.lead_paragraph: The buoyant jobs market that has helped sustain American households for the better part of a decade did not go anywhere.

articles.headline: TV’s New Golden Age Produces Financial Drama: Writers vs. Their Agents
articles.snippet: They were once so close. Now, writers are accusing their representatives of enriching themselves at their clients’ expense.
articles.abstract: They were once so close. Now, writers are accusing their representatives of enriching themselves at their clients’ expense.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hollywood agents have played a number of roles for television writers over the years. For a fee, they have served as dependable friends, occasional therapists and, most important, fierce advocates able to extract large sums from studio executives.

articles.headline: One Trump Victory: Companies Rethink China
articles.snippet: The trade war is nearing a possible truce, but global companies are nevertheless moving to reduce their dependence on Chinese factories to make the world’s goods.
articles.abstract: The trade war is nearing a possible truce, but global companies are nevertheless moving to reduce their dependence on Chinese factories to make the world’s goods.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Whatever deal Washington and Beijing reach over the trade war, President Trump has already scored a big victory: Companies are rethinking their reliance on China.

articles.headline: The New Equifax Boss Wants to Make Amends. We Have Some Questions.
articles.snippet: Mark Begor thinks Equifax can be the consumer-friendly credit bureau. So where are our free credit reports, automatic credit freezes for babies and consistent straight talk?
articles.abstract: Mark Begor thinks Equifax can be the consumer-friendly credit bureau. So where are our free credit reports, automatic credit freezes for babies and consistent straight talk?
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — A few years ago, Mark Begor checked his credit report, as befits a corporate executive with proper personal finance hygiene. It was filthy.

articles.headline: Modern Monetary Theory Finds an Embrace in an Unexpected Place: Wall Street
articles.snippet: M.M.T.’s fans include Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Bernie Sanders — and financial analysts at Goldman Sachs, Nomura and GMO.
articles.abstract: M.M.T.’s fans include Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Bernie Sanders — and financial analysts at Goldman Sachs, Nomura and GMO.
articles.lead_paragraph: The package of eccentric ideas known as modern monetary theory — for example, that annual deficits are too small, and that the United States can essentially print money to pay off its debt — has been on the receiving end of a remarkable level of vitriol.

articles.headline: Trump Says Fed Should Cut Rates and Lift Economy
articles.snippet: President Trump said on Friday that he wanted another round of quantitative easing from the central bank.
articles.abstract: President Trump said on Friday that he wanted another round of quantitative easing from the central bank.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday called on the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates and take additional steps to stimulate economic growth, his latest attempt to put the traditionally independent central bank under his thumb.
